name: Leah Lewy
tagline: Computer Science Major at The College of New Jersey
body:
Home: 20 Hageman Road Flemington, NJ 08822  
Phone: (908) 698-2296   
Email: lewyl1@tcnj.edu

Education
=========
###### The College of New Jersey 
 August 2013-May 2015  
Bachelor of Science: Computer Science, Minor: Criminology  
GPA: 4.0 / 4.0  
###### Elon University     								         
 August 2011 - January 2013   
Bachelor of Science: Computer Science  
GPA: 3.620 / 4.0  
Presidential Scholar, Dean’s List - 3 semesters  

Technical Skills
================	
######Platforms  
∗ Windows  
∗ Linux  
∗ Macintosh OSX
######Languages  
∗ Java - 2 years  
∗ SQL - 1 year  
∗ Python - 1 year    
∗ HTML / CSS - basic exposure, foundational knowledge  
######Software  
∗ Eclipse  
∗ Ant  
∗ Oracle  
∗ PostgreSQL

Technical Projects
====================
###### Computational Problem Solving in Java: 
∗	Implemented a multi-class traffic intersection simulator which included polymorphism, constructors, and collections
###### Database Design and Implementation:
∗	 Working towards improving the functionality and scope of the employed web-based system Students Organizing Against Pollution  
∗	Helping create the Lions Book Bazaar Database for The College of New Jersey 
###### Web Development: 
∗	Collaborated with a four person team at the 2014 MHacks to create a social money pooling web application

Involvement and Leadership
===========================
###### President, Women in Computer Science, TCNJ  	       			                   January 2014-Present
∗	Organize and run weekly meetings and oversee all projects performed by the organization
###### Fundraising and Social Outreach Chair, To Write Love on Her Arms, TCNJ	                    August 2013-Present
∗	Manage and run all fundraising and community events hosted by the TCNJ chapter
###### Associate Board Member, College Union Board, TCNJ  	                                              August 2013-Present
∗	Actively assisted in the orchestration of the Welcome Back Concert held at TCNJ in January  
∗	Routinely help plan and staff entertainment events hosted by the College Union Board
###### Crisis Intervention Volunteer, CrossRoads Sexual Assault Center, Elon, NC          August 2012-January 2013
∗	Operated crisis hotline and accompany sexual assault victims to hospital and forensic interviews 

Work Experience
================
Waitress, Dockside Market and Grill, Flemington, NJ				           May 2013-Present  
Waitress, AMC Dine-In Theaters, Bridgewater, NJ			                         	            May-August 2012  
Sales Representative, Harmon Cosmetics, Raritan, NJ 			         October 2010-August 2011
